titles.title: To amend the Safe Drinking Water Act to reauthorize the New York City Watershed Protection Program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment and Hazardous Materials.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by the Yeas and Nays: 19 - 7.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 40 - 0.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 108-476.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 271.

action.text: Mr. Gillmor moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2771.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 502.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Federal aid to water pollution control
Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 10/16/2004--Public Law. Amends the Safe Drinking Water Act to reauthorize the New York City Watershed Protection Program (which authorizes financial assistance to New York State for demonstration projects for the protection and enhancement of the quality of source waters of the New York City water supply system, including projects for comprehensive monitoring and surveillance and projects necessary to comply with the criteria for avoiding filtration) at previously authorized funding levels through FY 2010.
